intro: Hieracium villosifolium, commonly known as the woolly leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium villosifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
